intro: Vesicaria engelmannii, commonly known as Engelmann's bladder, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or greenish flowers. The plant has a short, erect stem with opposite, pinnately lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure known as a schizocarp, typical of the Apiaceae family. Vesicaria engelmannii is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
